data.title: B2K - Songs, Events and Music Stats
data.meta_description: B2K: Listen to new and popular songs, find events, look into their stats and see who their fans are.
data.text:
Four-piece R&B group B2K from Los Angeles, California, first appeared on the music industry in the early 2000s and swiftly rose to prominence as one of the most well-known boy bands of the time. B2K was a major force in Contemporary R&B music thanks to their slick harmonies and infectious beats.

Their music was a distinctive fusion of traditional R&B and contemporary pop with a dash of hip hop and soul tossed in. B2K's music is evocative and relevant since its songs frequently discuss love, heartbreak, and the ups and downs of relationships.

Despite having a brief career that ended with their dissolution in 2004, B2K had a profound influence on the R&B scene and helped to establish the path for subsequent boy bands as well as countless other musicians. Fans all over the world still adore their music, which is proof of the soulful sound's enduring strength.

R&B boy band B2K from Los Angeles, California, skyrocketed to fame in the early 2000s thanks to their distinctive sound and riveting live performances. They were well-liked by fans of R&B and modern R&B music because to the catchy melodies, danceable beats, and soft voices that frequently characterized their work. Bump, Bump, Bump (with P. Diddy), Uh Huh, Girlfriend, Gots Ta Be, What A Girl Wants, Why I Love You, Badaboom (featuring Fabolous), Girlfriend - Pied Piper Remix, Everything, and Why'd You Leave Me On Christmas are a few of their best songs.

Unquestionably, "Bump, Bump, Bump (feat. P. Diddy)" was one of B2K's biggest hits, reaching the top of the charts in various nations and nominating them for a Grammy. The song's catchy chorus and contagious pace got people moving all over the place. Another well-liked song that featured B2K's sultry voice and distinguishing sound was "Uh Huh". The peppy pace and memorable lyrics of the song made it a hit with listeners.

Other major songs that demonstrated the group's flexibility included "Girlfriend" and "Gots Ta Be." A Pied Piper remix and a snappy chorus on "Girlfriend" give the song a new, energetic vibe. The slower, more sentimental song "Gots Ta Be" demonstrated B2K's talent at delivering emotional words with soulful vocals.

In general, B2K's music is still relevant today thanks to its entrancing beats and soothing voices. Their songs have endured the test of time, and their continued popularity is evidence of their talent and the influence they had on the R&B and modern R&B music scenes.

B2K is a Los Angeles-based R&B and modern R&B band that has put out a number of albums and songs over the years. "The Remixes Vol. 2," their most recent album, was published in 2003. The album includes remixes of some of their well-known songs, including "Bump, Bump, Bump," "Girlfriend," and "Uh Huh." This album is a must-listen for fans of B2K since it exhibits the band's distinctive sound of slick harmonies and enticing beats.

"Body Up (20th Anniversary Remastered Mix)," the most recent song by B2K, was released in 2022. The song's sweet R&B vocals and lively dance beats demonstrate the band's artistic development and range. The band previously published "In The Arms Of The Wind" in 2020 and "One Fantasy for Two People" in 2019. These singles demonstrate the group's capacity to write stirring ballads and sensual R&B music, respectively.

Additionally, since its debut in 2004, "Badaboom" by B2K from their album "Pandemonium!" has been a fan favorite. The song, on which rapper Fabolous collaborated, exemplifies the band's perfect fusion of R&B and hip-hop. Overall, B2K's work displays their brilliance and inventiveness as a band and remains an important and influential component of the R&B genre.

The MGM Grand Hotel, Kia Forum, Oakland Arena, FTX Arena, and Little Caesars Arena are just a few of the prominent places where B2K has performed. Fans have always been amazed by and enjoyed their performances. Their stage presence is contagious, and many people have been moved by their songs.

At the Oakland Arena, they had one of their most memorable performances and sang their popular songs "Uh Huh" and "What a Girl Wants." The crowd was moving around, singing and dancing along with the music. The crowd was left wanting more as B2K's charisma and stage presence were on full show.

B2K has also performed at a number of music events, including as the BET Awards and the Essence Music Festival. The band has had the chance to meet with fans from around the world and exhibit their music through these shows. The band has consistently been able to bring their best selves to the stage, and their appearances at these festivals have always been highlights.

B2K has, overall, enjoyed success in the R&B and Contemporary R&B music scenes. One of the most skilled and well-liked bands in the business, their reputation has been cemented by appearances at prestigious venues and music festivals. Fans will never forget their concerts, and their music continues to inspire and enthrall listeners.

The American R&B and current R&B band B2K has worked with a variety of musicians over the course of their career. Bump, Bump, Bump (featuring P. Diddy), Badaboom (including Fabolous), Girlfriend - Pied Piper Remix (featuring R. Kelly), Tease (with Jhene & Romeo), and Feelin' Freaky (featuring B2K) (featuring Nick Cannon) are a few of their most well-known joint efforts.

"Bump, Bump, Bump" with P. Diddy is one of their most well-known joint projects. This song was a major smash that topped the charts in several different nations. B2K and P. Diddy worked together to create a snappy, lively song that is still a fan favorite today.

The R. Kelly-featuring song "Girlfriend - Pied Piper Remix" is another noteworthy collaboration. The song's remix version demonstrated the versatility of B2K as an R&B group while giving the original a new dimension. The song was well-liked by listeners and contributed to B2K's reputation in the music business.

Overall, B2K's partnerships with different musicians have immensely aided in their development as a group. Each partnership expanded their audience and added something special to their music.

How did B2K break up?

B2K's manager Chris Stokes announced the group's breakup in 2004 owing to internal conflicts. In a joint statement, Lil' Fizz, Raz-B, and J-Boog acknowledged the termination of their working partnership with Stokes.

What did J-Boog say about B2K?

"The Omarion show was never this thing we call B2K. Each of the guys brought a different draw, and as a whole, it was entertaining to see. It was more like a circus, according to J-Boog.

Was Marques Houston part of B2K?

Yes, Houston co-starred in the B2K vehicle "You Got Served" as Elgin. After B2K and Stokes split up, he and Stokes began working on Omarion.

How popular was B2K?

The American R&B group B2K was extremely well-liked; their self-titled first album peaked at #1 on the U.S. Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs albums list and #2 on the Billboard Top 200 chart.

Why was B2K mad at Omarion?

B2K was upset with Omarion because they said he was a fame hog and envious of his colleagues, and that Chris Brown and Bow Wow stole his career and tour, respectively.

What is the beef with B2K?

His B2K bandmate Lil' Fizz first began dating his baby mama Apryl Jones, and now J-Boog, another member of the group, is accused of assaulting his real mother!

Are B2K back together?

Yes, after 15 years, B2K is back together and on the road. They are Omarion, Raz-B, J-Boog, and others.

Did B2K change his name?

1999–2004: B2K member Omari changed his name to Omarion.

Who molested B2K?

According to a 2010 Essence article, Houston and Stokes (Raz B's cousin) are both accused of molestation of B2K members early in their musical careers.

Did B2K ever go platinum?

Due to the popularity of their smash track "Bump, Bump, Bump," B2K's second album, "Pandemonium," achieved platinum status.

How many #1 hits does B2K have?

Diddy) reached number 1 on the Billboard Hot 100....

How much did B2K make?

B2K's The Millennium Tour generated a career-high $5 million in revenue.

Did B2K break up?

After the three-hour B2K interview with "Drink Champs" was made public, Lil Fizz disclosed that the management of the American boy band had been secretly squandering the money belonging to the four lads, which had caused the band to break up.

Who sang B2K vocals?

Dreux "Li'l Fizz" Frederic, Omari "Omarion" Grandberry, Jarell "J-Boog" Houston, and De'Mario "Raz-B" Thornton are B2K members who sang vocals.

What ever happened to B2K?

'You Got Served' marked the end of B2K as a group. Chris Stokes and Omarion continued to collaborate, while the other three members disbanded and went their separate ways. B2K's lead singer, Omarion, also enjoyed the most financial success as a solo artist after the group disbanded.

How popular was b2k?

B2K, an American R&B group, enjoyed huge popularity. Their self-titled first album peaked at number one on the U.S. Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs albums chart and number two on the Billboard Top 200 chart.

Who owns the name B2K?

According to trademark registration number 5399105 and serial number 87189702 on Justia Trademarks, Omari Grandberry is the owner of B2K.

Is B2K a hip hop group?

Omarion, Lil' Fizz, Raz-B, and J-Boog made formed the Los Angeles, California-based R&B music group B2K.
